title: Learning to Hash for Indexing Big Data-A Survey
authors: J Wang, W Liu, S Kumar, SF Chang - arXiv preprint arXiv:1509.05472
excerpt: Abstract: The explosive growth in big data has attracted much attention in designing efficient indexing and search methods recently. In many critical applications such as large-scale search and pattern matching, finding the nearest neighbors to a query is a fundamental  ...

title: Learning both Weights and Connections for Efficient Neural Networks
authors: S Han, J Pool, J Tran, WJ Dally - arXiv preprint arXiv:1506.02626
excerpt: Abstract: Neural networks are both computationally intensive and memory intensive, making them difficult to deploy on embedded systems. Also, conventional networks fix the architecture before training starts; as a result, training cannot improve the architecture. To  ...
